thread.title_full: Yahoo Misses Q3 Earnings, and Marisa Mayer Eyes Narrower Product Focus - FinancialSpots.com

title: Yahoo Misses Q3 Earnings, and Marisa Mayer Eyes Narrower Product Focus - FinancialSpots.com
text:
Main / Money / Yahoo Misses Q3 Earnings, and Marisa Mayer Eyes Narrower Product Focus Yahoo Misses Q3 Earnings, and Marisa Mayer Eyes Narrower Product Focus By Betsy Taylor Oct 26, 2015 
On a call with analysts Tuesday, Ms. Mayer acknowledged her difficulty growing Yahoo's core business of advertising, and hinted at a major reorganization on the horizon. 
Its loss from operations totaled $86 million for the three-month period ending September 30, compared to $42 million of income a year ago. 
In October, the Company reached an agreement with Google that provides Yahoo with additional flexibility to choose among suppliers of search results and ads. 
With revenue after fees paid to partner Web sites falling to $1 billion, Mayer announced on Tuesday a search-ad agreement with Google to augment an existing deal with Microsoft . 
Yahoo! shares, off more than 15 percent over the past year, fell 1.5 percent, to $32.35, in after-hours trading. Squali rates shares as a buy with a $45 price target. 
Yahoo's report did not give details of the plan to spinoff of its 15% stake in Alibaba. 
No, Yahoo isn't beefing up its own search algorithms; it's actually using Google's. The transaction may save Yahoo about $9 billion in taxes. 
CFO Ken Goldman said the company's board authorized it to proceed with the spin-off, despite not receiving the early initial approval it had sought from the U.S. Internal Revenue Service. "We'd like to see if they can get that done this quarter, and if they can do it in a tax-free manner". Two of her top deputies- marketing chief Kathy Savitt and former acquisitions head Jacqueline Reses -left the company in the recent weeks, raising concerns about morale inside the company. Yahoo said its third-quarter earnings fell to $76 million, or 8 cents a share, from $6.77 billion, or $6.70 a share, a year ago. 
Thomson Reuters had forecast earnings of 17 cents per share based on an average of analyst estimates, The Wall Street Journal said. While Mayer and her team have talked about the impressive growth of this group - up 55% year over year to $255 million in the second quarter - investors have noted there is confusion about this. Mayer framed it as an opportunity to simplify the company's structure and improve expense discipline. 
Apart from its Alibaba stake, Doshi said he'd be watching for growth in Yahoo's mobile , video , native advertising and social spaces. On Sunday, the company will stream, for free, a National Football League game featuring the Jacksonville Jaguars and Buffalo Bills. 
Earlier this month, the company revamped its mobile e-mail application with a cleaner look. Still, a few analysts doubt these initiatives will be enough to reverse the company's trajectory. You may also like...
